page.title: 02Friday Bridge Village
page.content: Friday Bridge was formed into an ecclesiastical parish out of Elm in 1860. In the village was situated the Manor of Beauford which name os forst recorded in 1321 when it was held by the Bishop of Lichfield. The name still exists as the 18th century Beauford House. Friday Bridge lies approximately 4 miles south of Wisbech along the B1101 which serves as a secondary road between the towns of Wisbech and March. The village has developed on a system of roads radiating out from the centre as defined by the Clock Tower.
